messages: c806f7170b0f2e62317067282d38646d (16:30): hello, can anyone guide me the best query to select only the field names in a table ?

6857d579004c31f1efc078cb6c8c543f (16:38): vietnamese: EXPLAIN TABLE x or SHOW CREATE TABLE x - but if you want it as a result set and are using mysql5, you can use the table in the mysql "meta" database.
6857d579004c31f1efc078cb6c8c543f (16:39): vietnamese: or just do select * from x limit 0 and look at the field names in the meta-info of the result.
6857d579004c31f1efc078cb6c8c543f (16:39): that'S a hack, but should work.

9980c6a2c2fbf516fa29cab8a8ee43a1 (17:08): what's a nice way to tell mysqld to shut down (have started it directly to sort out inno-db issues... now want to shut it down without corrupting the log files or anything...)
befd5cdaef9d985c57459054bb6bfd13 (17:10): service mysqld restart should do the trick
9980c6a2c2fbf516fa29cab8a8ee43a1 (17:11): alphablue: fedora core 5, but i started mysqld directly in console mode so mysql.server script won't find it
9980c6a2c2fbf516fa29cab8a8ee43a1 (17:12): if i have to explain it it won't be funny anymore :-)
9980c6a2c2fbf516fa29cab8a8ee43a1 (17:14): right, tried SIGTERM... that did it
9980c6a2c2fbf516fa29cab8a8ee43a1 (17:14): aha it even shut down cleanly according to the console

e46924a2dc71e184eb68e91c7a8e757d (18:22): This brings up a syntax error:
e46924a2dc71e184eb68e91c7a8e757d (18:22): GRANT ALL ACCESS ON alp.* TO alp@'%';
e46924a2dc71e184eb68e91c7a8e757d (18:22): (I'll add IDENTIFIED BY later on, I've tried it with and without.)

e46924a2dc71e184eb68e91c7a8e757d (18:23): "ERROR 1064 (42000): You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near 'ACCESS ON alp.* TO alp@'%'' at line 1"
ac5c74b64b4b8352ef2f181affb5ac2a (18:24): GRANT: (Conventions Used in This Manual) : http://dev.mysql.com/doc/mysql/en/Manual_conventions.html
3446266097452410834d63a9d676b3f2 (18:25): terribleCabbage, GRANT ALL ON alp.* TO 'alp'@'%' IDENTIFIED BY 'someSekretPwd';
e46924a2dc71e184eb68e91c7a8e757d (18:25): I am a noob. Gods. I've only been writing that statement for the better part of two years.
e46924a2dc71e184eb68e91c7a8e757d (18:26): I even read the manual page without twigging. ;)
